intro: Psilopogon schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its leaves are usually alternate and may have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Psilopogon schimperi is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in its native habitat.
